message: Added the ability to attch_reference_solution to the exact_error_estimator for purposes of using a comparison to a fine grid solution as an error estimator

Added the copy_nodal_solution function.  This allows you to read in a solution and store it while reading in a mesh  and then later  after you have created and initialized an EquationSystems object  copy the nodal solution from the GMVIO object into the EquationSystems and start using it.
Attempted fix for unknown compilers with questionable multimap support
Changes to the following header files to make them pass the contrib/bin/test_headers.sh script.
Changed arguments to encript from -W html to --language=html  though it seems both should be correct.
Make the create_example_docs script start from ex0 instead of ex1
Ben is no longer a student.  Added a commented-out entry for Derek.
Latest version of examples documentation.  Why is this in CVS again?
Utility wrapper for common MPI_ calls
Run only examples  and in numerical order
Factored out MPI_Allreduce code into Parallel:: methods
Added link to final version of LibMesh Paper.
Added a link to Ben's dissertation  which is a whopping 32Mb!
Fixes for when HAVE_MPI is undefined
Added overview presentations from ERDC  semiconductors class
Moved EWC paper to top  Ben's dissertation after
Added blank image  fixed entry for Derek
Emphasize CFDLab development  add Sandia & NASA references
White background with more muted but color image
Added the rest of the publications I had on hand.
Added some more words to the index page  also made the content div have a minimum height.
Made bg image smaller and over to the side.
Only do slanty text on Gecko-enabled browsers.
Use the "Gecko" CSS for Konqueror and Opera  even though they do not report NW_IS_GECKO.
Fix to make parallel .bz2 writes reliable
IE does not support the CSS "float" option for images.
More reliable bz2 handling on parallel runs

User can now specify segments for a PSLG explicitly or rely on the implicit PSLG if desired.  Also added an option to turn off mesh smoothing after triangulation. This can be useful e.g. when generating a mesh with multiple segments which you do not want to be violated by a smoother.

Added recalculate_n_partitions() function to MeshBase.  The number of partitions the mesh thinks it has can be wrong if e.g. you change some of the element processor_ids by hand instead of using a Partitioner.
Fix for H^2 norm compilation with complex number support
Checked in Tim Kroger's diagonal_selection()  select_diagonal()  reselect_diagonal()  and reselect_optimal_diagonal() functions.
Fix in parent error estimation code
We use an AutoPtr outside of the #ifdefs  so we should include auto_ptr.h
Changes throughout the code to allow it to compile on Solaris using Sun's compiler suite.
Added "-Wno-long-long" warning to GCC options  some MPI implementations declare long long variables.
Patch for safely coarsening a perturbed mesh
fixed for osx  causes gmvread to behave
syntax fix for when MPI is not present
Added PETSC_VERSION_LESS_THAN macro to make supporting different versions of PETSc easier.
Added note about the unorthodox splitting of QUAD8s  and added some asserts which should make attaching cell-centered data a little less error-prone.
avoid vec.clear() not reducing memory usage
Do more tasks in numeric instead of alphabetical order

Initial check-in of (experimental) ContinuationSystem code.  This is basically a new type of System (derived from FEMSystem) which you can in turn derive your own System from.  It will hopefully allow generic arclength continuation for a System parameter of your choice  provided you add the additional required matrix assembly code.  Still probably a good deal of bugs and non-robust code to be worked out  so use with caution.
use quadtrees in the point locator for planar 2D meshes
added a stop() macro which forces a serial run to stop at the desired point until a SIGCONT is recieved

increased granularity of performance logging  fixed a bug in DofMap::add_neighbors_to_send_list() which caused the _send_list to become excessively large.  Further  this slowed the DofMap::sort_send_list() method considerably.
did not mean to check in these two

increased granularity of performance logging  fixed a bug in DofMap::add_neighbors_to_send_list() which caused the _send_list to become excessively large.  Further  this slowed the DofMap::sort_send_list() method considerably.

increased granularity of performance logging  fixed a bug in DofMap::add_neighbors_to_send_list() which caused the _send_list to become excessively large.  Further  this slowed the DofMap::sort_send_list() method considerably.

increased granularity of performance logging  fixed a bug in DofMap::add_neighbors_to_send_list() which caused the _send_list to become excessively large.  Further  this slowed the DofMap::sort_send_list() method considerably.
use the NODES method to populate Octree-based PointLocators since it is much  much faster
truly empty nodes array after it is used to populate the tree
Once the boundary mesh is sync'd  remove all unconnected nodes.
put a point_locator in the mesh
Print debugging constraint info to any ostream  not just cout
If we're going to spell Phyllis Nicolson's name right  we might as well spell it right everywhere...
New max_growth parameter  new deltat resizing behavior  some refactoring
PerfLog the time spent calculating norms
Avoid infinite template recursion with icc 7.1
updated configure to accept command-line options for the compilers and to print the configuration information into libmesh_config.h
updated configure to accept command-line options for the compilers and to print the configuration information into libmesh_config.h
added a unique namespace for libmesh make variables
Added stubs for first Mesh parallelization methods
backslashed quotes being eaten on IRIX and AIX  do not use them
do not include petscconf.  this has bitten me for the last time.
get the link/include stuff at configure time
Added VTKIO class by Wout Ruijter and configure options to link against VTK if it is available.
Do not add -Wno-deprecated as a general CXXFLAG.  It triggers other warnings on C files.
Remember to always stop perflogging calculate_norm()
Fix for coarsening code with use_old_dof_indices==false
Don't prepare_for_use - it does too much
This commit was manufactured by cvs2svn to create tag 'pre_serialmesh'.
Added SerialMesh  UnstructuredMesh classes to MeshBase tree
Can only set _p_level when ENABLE_AMR is off
Add test for gcc ABI demangling (necessary for in-code stack traces)
Don't compile when we may not have dl functions available
Additional test to avoid breaking cygwin
Add Elem::set_parent() function for use by MeshModification code
Make Elem::_parent non-const for use in MeshModification methods
More Mesh refactoring - node  element storage details pushed out into SerialMesh and ParallelMesh
New dependencies based on SerialMesh  ParallelMesh refactoring
Bugfixes against time when max_elem_id > n_elem
Don't try to write twice to files with both .dat and .plt in them
Use T (PetscScalar  may be complex) for PetscVector::sum return
(Hopefully) better configuration and implementation of print_trace()
New VTK code from Wout Ruijter
fixed for the case of no VTK.
Use UnstructuredMesh instead of Mesh where possible
Only need a MeshBase  not Mesh
Add ENABLE_PARMESH option (disabled by default) to use ParallelMesh as Mesh
Revision number update (ran autoconf after cvs commit configure.in...)
Added access to the VTK Unstructured grid  also a test in committing source
no need for the #ifdefs since the vtkUnstructuredGrid is forward declared and only used as a pointer.  This fixes a bug for the case of no VTK support
cast to a long int to match the print statement.  Alternatively  could change %ld to %d?
updated compiler flags for PGI 7.0-7 compilers
give a hint as to which std::sqrt<>() to call.  Required for pgCC
const bool return type is meaningless - replace with bool
For the VTK connectivity function  if the user requests a "subchild" other than zero  throw an error.  The VTK Hex20 is implemented as a single element.
Do not use char buffer to set filename.
Added the axes_limit string.  Allows you to specify the limits of the axes used in GNUplot's 2D output.
added SPAI_LIB in case PETSc is built with SPAI support
Added bibtex-format citations.  Also added "official" libMesh citation.
This commit was manufactured by cvs2svn to create tag 'libmesh-0_6_1-rc1'.
This code still has a good deal of extraneous comments  etc and shouldn't be used unless you know what you are doing.
used uint without typedefing it.  Sun compiler caught this
First check-in of the generalized EigenTimeSolver based on Steffen's Slepc solver.  This code is largely untested and probably shouldn't be used yet unless you know what you're doing.
explicit casts to help sun compilers figure out which overloaded std::pow to use
remove deprecated char*  replaced with const char*
Include numeric_vector.h  not petsc_vector.h which we may not be compiled to use
allow the user to specify which method to use when building a PointLocatorTree from MeshFunction
Trying out a different underlying container for ParallelMesh
Added option to set initial Newton tolerance.  Added ability to turn off stepgrowth based on # Newton steps req'd for convergence.
Only add the matrix B to the system if the user has not already added it.
Switch to element iterators rather than indexing  for ParallelMesh compatibility
Use element iterators instead of indexing for ParallelMesh compatibility
Add a quick comment to mapvector class
Don't run ex12 in parallel  MeshData objects don't get set correctly from a parallel Mesh::read().  We should probably fix that someday.
This commit was manufactured by cvs2svn to create tag 'libmesh-0_6_1'.
Adding new Parallel:: helper functions  testing out subversion
surely this is what you mean -- for (unsigned int i=mysize  i != 0  ++i) is an infinite loop!
beginnings of a unit test framework
make ::localize() more efficient  still need to handle ::localize_to_one()
use templates to test things derived from NumericVector<>.  something wrong with PetscVector<>  though...
use templates to test things derived from NumericVector<>.  something wrong with PetscVector<>  though...
OK  that was subtle.  PETSc must #define VectType  so use NumericVectorType as the template parameter instead

Support for SLEPc 2.3.3.  It looks like the changes to SLEPc will be similar to those which happen in PETSc.  Whereas SLES went to KSP+PC in PETSC  in SLEPC  we have some of the EPS functionality splitting off into an IP (inner product) object.
move vector_union to vector_allgather  add vector_gather
move vector_union to allgather(vec)   add gather(root vec)
offer --cxx option in usage statement.  The option was there  but not displayed in the usage summary.
Name change from vector_union to allgather
Added wrapper for MPI_SendRecv of arbitrary vectors
sum  send_receive shouldn't crash with empty vectors
log some of the potentially more expensive parallel operations
Fix tag  swapped proc id bugs
reserve() space for efficiency since the information we need to do that is freely available.
reserve() space for efficiency since the information we need to do that is freely available.
Make sure we iterate over parents before children when necessary
Remove overzealous warning - we should be able to contract active and delete subactive elements in any order
Support 1D meshes and set the default mesh color to black.
Count numbers of linear  quasi-Newton iterations
added a method to get the element-weight processor-wise
added a method to get the number of local nodes
add an insert_node() method which parallels the insert_elem()
added an untested allgather() method for ParallelMesh
reserve() the right number  remember to add the element processor_id()  and check global sizes without communication
set the childrens node keys  add child element to its parent
set the childrens node keys  add child element to its parent
print a more useful error message
must be careful with insert_node() in the case of a node with the specified ID already existing.
Added print_converged_reason() member function.  This uses the KSPGetConvergedReason(...) functionality of PETSc  and prints a message about why the most recent linear solve converged (or diverged).
Added the newton_progress_check flag  and made the newton_stepgrowth_aggressiveness a class member.  Also  check for initial linear solve tolerance too loose (solver exits in zero iterations.)
Avoid compile bug with --disable-amr and warning with --disable-mpi
Don't reserve more request memory than we'll need
Request MeshBase references  not Mesh references  with get_mesh()
Return MeshBase references  not Mesh references  from get_mesh

Added pure virtual read()/write() interface to MeshBase. Note that these could and probably should eventually be concrete implementations in mesh_base.C.  That way a CartesianMesh (i.e. something not derived from UnstructuredMesh) could utilize the same functionality.

The DivaIO class was templated on UnstructuredMesh but MeshBase appears to be good enough.  This code generates output  but we haven't had a working copy of the DIVA viz software for some time  so there's no way to know if it's actually working...
Loop over only local elements when assembling in serial
Don't delete unpartitioned elements or their node neighbors
Only assign nodes to processors which own *active* elements containing them
Add sanity check to look for unpartitioned nodes
Assign processor ids to new nodes added by element refinement
Another bugfix in the sanity check
Make sure subactive nodes are partitioned too
Make sure nodes are assigned to a processor where they're active if possible
Make print_convergence_reason a base class method (even if only implemented with Petsc for now)
Call print_convergence_reason as a base class method
Ensure consistently partitioned nodes even on distributed meshes.
Don't delete ancestors of undeleted elements
Added static global remote_elem pointer for use with ParallelMesh
Do test_level_one in parallel  keeping return value globally valid
For now  don't try to run AMR examples with ParallelMesh
Set appropriate neighbor pointers to remote_elem when deleting remote elements.
Renumber dof objects to shrink their containers after deleting the remote objects
I hate to force a rebuild for a documentation change  but this one is important...
update neighbors after allgather()ing the mesh
Added n_unpartitioned_* methods  fixed ParallelMesh::n_* methods
Assert a contiguous node numbering before building a nodal solution vector
Don't leave ancestor elements unpartitioned - if they're left with processor_id 0 it leads to load imbalance  if they're left with invalid_processor_id it breaks assertions.
Make n_* functions use cached data
New add_node method  to allow calling processors to specify via processor_id whether they're adding a local or an unpartitioned node.
Add optional processor_id argument to add_point
Add optional processor_id argument to add_point
Set processor_id=0 when adding points and elements with a Mesh.read()  so ParallelMesh doesn't get confused.
Fix the "more processors than active elements" case.
Tiny optimization for send_receive(vector)  addition of send_receive(vector<vector>)
explicitly check that the mesh is serialized
Set parent and child links to remote_elem on ghost elements  not just neighbor links
Add an assert(!p_level) for now  unless it's fixed that could trigger confusing bugs later.
Added Parallel::min/max (i.e. logical and/or) for type bool Added MPI_Datatype entries for char/unsigned char
Fall back on returning DistributedVector if PETSc and LASPack aren't enabled  don't just error()
Allow command-line disabling of LASPACK and PETSc
Don't call compute_children_node_keys  we don't use them anymore.
Remove obsolete Elem::key() and Node::key()  use hashed Point locations as keys for MeshRefinement instead.
Send global error messages to cerr  but only one copy even in parallel
Added renumber_* functions  allow ParallelMesh::add_* to add nonlocal prepartitioned objects.
More parallel synchronization code for MeshRefinement
Fix node renumbering  add ghost element synchronization
Clearing mesh is implicitly a type of serialization
Added more asserts  fixed stupid _is_serial bug
Don't try to allgather unnecessarily - for one thing  it may break on non-parallel meshes whose dofobject ids aren't in blocks by processor!
Fixed indexing bug in parallel consistency code
Infinite loop bug fix in parallel consistency code
Fix _new_nodes_map bug  use a more reliable key for n0 n1 n2 large
Don't try to renumber correctly numbered nodes
Reenable parallel code for testing of cached code  cache bugfixes
Prototypes for parallel checking code of cached n_* values
Additional parallel debugging code in while loops  bugfix with ParallelMesh
Disable repartitioning in parallel  add parallel_only() macros where appropriate
Explicitly serialize for I/O  Don't try to skip AMR examples with ParallelMesh anymore
Fixes for code that might encounter remote_elem
Assert valid return value from which_neighbor_am_i
Assert valid return value from which_neighbor_am_i
Assert valid return value from which_neighbor_am_i
Don't error() if which_neighbor_am_i fails  just return invalid_uint
New assert_valid_neighbors() test  bugfixes in find_neighbors()
Test for valid neighbors after a delete_remote_elements()
Adding some of Ben's old tests to the new system
Fixes in make_links_to_me_remote  assert valid which_neighbor_am_i
Use macros to pull in inherited tests.
Redo test structure of Point to get tests from a TypeVectorTestBase
Couple of small changes for unit testing
Move Node from Base to Geom
Explicit casts from RefinementState -> unsigned int
Fixed MeshTools::n_levels() with non-serial meshes  subactive elements  added local and active n_*_levels() versions
Return a real n_levels  not just the largest level number
Assume parents are only remotified before their children are  there's no good way to delete parents before their children (when child->level() might be called) anyway.
Need to use n_levels in find_neighbors()  or find a better way count levels including ghost elements.
Parallel flag consistency may need to come first (to avoid false positives from outdated ghost element flags) and last (to fix any inconsistency generated by previous flag smoothing operations)
Communicate refinement flags and p_level in pack_element.
Don't prepare requests to be sent to the same processor
Use MeshTools::n_levels() instead of hard-coded level count
Return NULL pointers to indicate non-existent elements/nodes

Allow overwriting remote_elem in Elem::add_child()  this gets done by allgather().  We'll still need to add an optional which_child_am_i argument to add_child  I think  at the moment we're getting children in the right place by luck.
"Forgot to allocate memory before copy()" bug fixed.
Disable ex8 with ParallelMesh until we replace that explicit serial loop over every node.
Fixed "tried to double-add ghost child elements" bug
Add children to fixed positions  in case allgather doesn't receive them in ascending order.
Initial checkin of netcdf and exodus source into contrib.
Initial Exodus solution reading steps... can now get timesteps  var names and nodal values for a var
do not use MPI_CHAR when MPI_MAX is needed
fix the build rule to omit all the other libmesh includes
add libHilbert hilbert index utility library
add libHilbert hilbert index utility library
OK to use chars for Parallel::send_receive
checkin of incomplete global indices routine
Delete remote_elem links when doing a Mesh allgather
Don't finish enforce_constraints_exactly() too early when not all processors are aware of all constraints
Exodus meshes can now be written
Added clone() virtual copy constructor  all_*_order to MeshBase
Fixed typo in new bounding_box code
can now compute global  partition agnostic node and element indices
Added header to fix complaints about undefined ostream
libMesh can now write solutions to Exodus files
keyword expansion in all source files
Create a tag for libmesh-0.6.2 - bugfix on top of 0.6.1.
